meanings.definition: To excrete perspiration through the pores in the skin.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside, the children were sweating from running around.
meanings.sent2: She starts sweating when she exercises at the gym.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream was so cold that it had the whole family sweating with brain freeze.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat had the metal statue sweating droplets of water.
meanings.sent5: The nervous speaker was sweating profusely under the bright stage lights.

meanings.definition: To work hard or struggle in a difficult situation.
meanings.sent1: The team was sweating to finish the project before the deadline.
meanings.sent2: He was sweating over his final exams all week.
meanings.sent3: The chef was sweating over the stove to prepare the perfect dish.
meanings.sent4: The detective was sweating to solve the complex case.
meanings.sent5: The students were sweating over the challenging math problem.
